730782f-b.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - Staten Island - [Arthur Kill - Old Place Creek.]

730783f-b.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - [Old Place, Staten Island - Elizabeth, New Jersey.]
730783f-b.text:
(1) and (2)
Goethals Bridger The south side of the bridge,
viewed westward across the Sfaten Island marshes. The bridge links
Old Place, Staten Island with Elizabeth, New Jersey.
View 1: July 8, 1928
View 2: August 26, 1930
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
The north side of the bridge, seen across oil pipes
near the Baltimore and Bhio Railroad.
November 15, 1936
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUUCTIONS

730785f-a.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - [Arthur Kill, Staten Island.]
730785f-a.text:
(1)
Goethals Bridger Viewing west across Arthur Kill toward
New Jersey.
June 14, 1935
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
A view of the bridge, looking south on Arthur Kill from
the New Jersey shore. Also shown is the Baltimore and Ohio
Railroad drawbridge.
June 14, 1935
P. L. Sperr
NO REERODUCTIONS
(3)
The bridge, as seen from Staten Island.
November 15, 1936
P. L. Sperr

730781f-a.title: Bridges - Goethals Bridge - Staten Island
730781f-a.text:
11)
Goethals Bridge Site (Staten Island): Where the bridge
plasa was later constructed at the end of Forest Avenue.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Looking inland across the bridge site from near
Arthur Kill.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
Site of the approach to the bridge, neaP Western Avenues
Before the bridge was officially named Goethals Bridge, it was
known at the time of construction as the Howland Hook-Elisabeth
Bridge.
March 5, 1927
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
